explanation.text:
Explanation
The first temptation was the devil telling Jesus to turn stone to bread if he were the son of God. Luke 4:3
The second temptation was when the devil promised to give Jesus the authority and splendor of the world if he bows and worships him (the devil). Luke 4:6-7
And the third temptation was when the devil led Jesus to the highest point of the temple and dared him to throw himself down and see if God will not send his angels to catch him from falling. Luke 4:9-10

text: '''If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down from here; for it is written, 'He will give his angels charge of you...''
